head.title: National Briefing | South: Tennessee: University Cannot Sell Artwork, Judge Says

hedline.hl1: National Briefing | South: Tennessee: University Cannot Sell Artwork, Judge Says
hedline.hl2: Tennessee: University Cannot Sell Artwork, Judge Says

abstract.p: Nashville judge rules that Fisk University cannot sell artwork from its Stieglitz Collection by Georgia O'Keeffe and Marsden Hartley; university planned to sell two paintings to bolster its endowment and pay for campus improvements (S)

block.p: A Nashville judge has ruled that Fisk University cannot sell artwork from its Stieglitz Collection, including Georgia O'Keeffe's signature painting ''Radiator Building-Night, New York.'' Tuesday's chancery court ruling came in a legal dispute over the university's right to sell the O'Keeffe and a painting by Marsden Hartley; both were donated by Ms. O'Keeffe in 1949. The university announced plans to sell the two paintings in late 2005 to bolster its endowment and pay for campus improvements.
A Nashville judge has ruled that Fisk University cannot sell artwork from its Stieglitz Collection, including Georgia O’Keeffe’s signature painting “Radiator Building-Night, New York.”

A Nashville judge has ruled that Fisk University cannot sell artwork from its Stieglitz Collection, including Georgia O'Keeffe's signature painting ''Radiator Building-Night, New York.'' Tuesday's chancery court ruling came in a legal dispute over the university's right to sell the O'Keeffe and a painting by Marsden Hartley; both were donated by Ms. O'Keeffe in 1949. The university announced plans to sell the two paintings in late 2005 to bolster its endowment and pay for campus improvements.
